phrase.cizu_name: discretion is the better part of valour

jx.jx_en_mean: (proverb)it's better to avoid a dangerous situation than to confront it

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in the sense 'discernment'): via Old French from Latin discretio(n-) 'separation' (in late Latin 'discernment'), from discernere (see discern)

entry.def: Discretion is the quality of behaving in a quiet and controlled way without drawing attention to yourself or giving away personal or private information.

example.ex: Larsson sometimes joined in the fun, but with more discretion...
example.tran: 拉森有时会和大家一起玩乐，但是显得更加矜持。

example.ex: He appreciated his discretion and his fidelity.
example.tran: 他欣赏他的谨慎和忠诚。

entry.tran: 自行决定的自由;酌情决定权
entry.def: If someone in a position of authority uses their discretion or has the discretion to do something in a particular situation, they have the freedom and authority to decide what to do.

example.ex: This committee may want to exercise its discretion to look into those charges...
example.tran: 这个委员会可能想行使其自行决定权来调查那些指控。

example.ex: School governors have the discretion to allow parents to withdraw pupils in exceptional circumstances.
example.tran: 学校管理者有权允许家长们在特殊情况下让学生退学。

entry.def: If something happens at someone's discretion, it can happen only if they decide to do it or give their permission.

example.ex: We may vary the limit at our discretion and will notify you of any change...
example.tran: 我们可能会斟酌改变限额，有任何变动将通知您。

example.ex: Where there are no service charges added to the bill, tip at your discretion...
example.tran: 凡账单上没收服务费的，是否付小费由你自己决定。

entry.tran: 谨慎即大勇;勇敢贵在审慎
entry.def: If you say discretion is the better part of valour, you mean that avoiding a dangerous or unpleasant situation is sometimes the most sensible thing to do.

means.word_mean: 1. freedom to act or judge on one's own
2. knowing how to avoid embarrassment or distress;

sentences.sentence: "the servants showed great tact and discretion"

means.word_mean: 4. the power of making free choices unconstrained by external agencies
5. the trait of judging wisely and objectively;

auth_sentence.content: Remove police discretion to recruit former convicts as officers.
auth_sentence.res_content: Remove police discretion to recruit former convicts as officers.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Remove police discretion to recruit former convicts as officers.

auth_sentence.content: "You have absolutely no discretion," he said.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: "You have absolutely no discretion," he said.

auth_sentence.content: Discretion is an important part of the law.
auth_sentence.res_content: Discretion is an important part of the law.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Discretion is an important part of the law.

stems_affixes.word_buile: dis分开+cret区别+e→分开区别→不同的
se分开+cret区别→分开来放→秘密的
discrete[adj.分立的]+ion动作或状态→discretion谨慎,小心
se分开+cret分辨+e→分辨开→分泌;藏起来

sentences.en: You must show discretion in choosing your friend.

means.word_mean: 自行决定的自由；自行决定权

sentences.en: Bail is granted at the discretion of the court.
sentences.cn: 由法庭决定是否准予保释。

sentences.en: There is no service charge and tipping is at your discretion.
sentences.cn: 不收服务费，给不给小费您看着办。

sentences.en: This case should be settled at the discretion of the court.
